oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Groundbreaking at E.S. Rose Park, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1959, Vol. 3 p. 88
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph taken at the groundbreaking of E.S. Rose Park and recreation center, April 1959. The park is named for Reverend E.S. Rose, Pastor of Bethel African Methodist Episcopal Church, and the community center was named for Reverend T.H. Easley, Pastor of the New Hope Baptist Church. Photographer unknown. Photograph used by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1959. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
